title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 1205.2 - Definition
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 1205.2 - Definition

State Regulations
A cooperative business arrangement is a
contractual relationship between a lawyer or law firm and a nonlegal
professional or nonlegal professional service firm for the purpose of offering
to the public, on a systematic and continuing basis, legal services performed
by the lawyer or law firm, as well as other nonlegal professional services, as
authorized by section 1200.5 -c of this Title. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22
ยง
1205.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
